subject: Re: Memory usage in Junit 4.4
msgSnippet: Both the approaches are equivalent. I wrote 1) A small test that uses 1KB of memory. 2) Duplicated the test 10,000 times 3) Checked meory with both the
messageBody:
Both the approaches are equivalent. I wrote
1) A small test that uses 1KB of memory.
2) Duplicated the test 10,000 times
3) Checked meory with both the approaches.


In the latest version of Junit i.e. 4.4, it is not necessary to null
the variable in the teardown. Apparently, JUnit 4.4 does not keep a
reference to the testcase object created for executing a test function.

Thanks................Vijay.
